ArticleTitle.sentence: Cell type specificity and activation requirements for NFAT-1 (nuclear factor of activated T-cells) transcriptional activity determined by a new method using transgenic mice to assay transcriptional activity of an individual nuclear factor.

event.clue: Cell type specificity and activation requirements for NFAT-1 (nuclear factor of activated T-cells) transcriptional activity determined by a new method using transgenic mice to assay transcriptional activity of an individual nuclear factor.

AbstractText.sentence: Nuclear factor of activated T-cells (NFAT-1) is a transcription factor which is considered to be an important regulator in early T-cell activation.

event.clue: Nuclear factor of activated T-cells (NFAT-1) is a transcription factor which is considered to be an important regulator in early T-cell activation.
Nuclear factor of activated T-cells (NFAT-1) is a transcription factor which is considered to be an important regulator in early T-cell activation.

AbstractText.sentence: We have developed a system to monitor the transcriptional activity of NFAT-1 at the single cell level in whole animals.

event.clue: We have developed a system to monitor the transcriptional activity of NFAT-1 at the single cell level in whole animals.

AbstractText.sentence: The system is based on the use of an oligomerized NFAT-1 binding motif that directs transcription of SV40 T-antigen in transgenic mice.

event.clue: The system is based on the use of an oligomerized NFAT-1 binding motif that directs transcription of SV40 T-antigen in transgenic mice.
The system is based on the use of an oligomerized NFAT-1 binding motif that directs transcription of SV40 T-antigen in transgenic mice.

AbstractText.sentence: This report represents the first demonstration that a multimerized short binding motif can function appropriately in transgenic mice.

event.clue: This report represents the first demonstration that a multimerized short binding motif can function appropriately in transgenic mice.

AbstractText.sentence: NFAT-1 activity had previously been thought to be confined to activated T-lymphocytes upon release of intracellular calcium.

event.clue: NFAT-1 activity had previously been thought to be confined to activated T-lymphocytes upon release of intracellular calcium.

AbstractText.sentence: By targeting NFAT-1-dependent gene expression in transgenic mice we discovered new sites of NFAT-1 activity.

event.clue: By targeting NFAT-1-dependent gene expression in transgenic mice we discovered new sites of NFAT-1 activity.

AbstractText.sentence: Besides in T-lymphocytes NFAT-1 activity could also be induced in T-lymphocyte-depleted spleen cells and purified B-lymphocytes and requires agents that both release intracellular calcium and activate protein kinase C.

event.clue: Besides in T-lymphocytes NFAT-1 activity could also be induced in T-lymphocyte-depleted spleen cells and purified B-lymphocytes and requires agents that both release intracellular calcium and activate protein kinase C.

AbstractText.sentence: A difference in the time course of appearance of NFAT-1 activity between T-lymphocytes and non-T-lymphocytes was revealed.

event.clue: A difference in the time course of appearance of NFAT-1 activity between T-lymphocytes and non-T-lymphocytes was revealed.

AbstractText.sentence: Constitutive expression was observed in a small population of cells in the dermis and some mice have developed skin lesions.

event.clue: Constitutive expression was observed in a small population of cells in the dermis and some mice have developed skin lesions.

AbstractText.sentence: Interestingly, the tissue pattern of expression of the NFAT-1 activity resembles the expression pattern described for HIV-LTR/tat transgenic mice (Vogel, J., Hinrichs, S. H., Reynolds, R. K., Luciw, P. A., and Jay, G. (1988) Nature 335, 606-611).

event.clue: Interestingly, the tissue pattern of expression of the NFAT-1 activity resembles the expression pattern described for HIV-LTR/tat transgenic mice (Vogel, J., Hinrichs, S. H., Reynolds, R. K., Luciw, P. A., and Jay, G. (1988) Nature 335, 606-611).

Interestingly, the tissue pattern of expression of the NFAT-1 activity resembles the expression pattern described for HIV-LTR/tat transgenic mice (Vogel, J., Hinrichs, S. H., Reynolds, R. K., Luciw, P. A., and Jay, G. (1988) Nature 335, 606-611).

AbstractText.sentence: This similarity in expression and the fact that NFAT-1 has been shown to bind functional sequences in HIV-LTR suggest a role for NFAT-1 in dermal activation of the HIV-LTR.

event.clue: This similarity in expression and the fact that NFAT-1 has been shown to bind functional sequences in HIV-LTR suggest a role for NFAT-1 in dermal activation of the HIV-LTR.
